gov.usgs.anss.util

Class StaSrv

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.anss.util.StaSrv

  • public final class StaSrv
extends java.lang.Object
    This class uses the Stasrv service (originally on neisa, nsn8) to retrieve metadata from the server. It opens the server only once and keeps the link open so it can be used many times.
    The service has a Timeout thread which can be set to interrupt a transaction by closing the socket at a user specified number of millis (default=30);

    • Constructor Detail

      • StaSrv

        public StaSrv(java.lang.String h,
              int p)
        Creates a new instance of StaSrv
        Parameters:
        h - The host string of the server to use (try metadataserver property, then def=cwbpub.cr.usgs.gov)
        p - The port to use on that server (if less than or equal to zero def=2052)

      • StaSrv

        public StaSrv(java.lang.String h,
              int p,
              int ms)
        Creates a new instance of StaSrv
        Parameters:
        h - The host string of the server to use (if null or empty property metdataserver def=cwbpub.cr.usgs.gov)
        p - The port to use on that server (if less or equal to zero def=2052)
        ms - timeout time in millis

      • doSelect

        public void doSelect(java.lang.String select,
                     java.lang.StringBuilder sb)
        This allows select statements to be run against the database. Data is returned in a string builder with the fields separated by pipe characters
        Parameters:
        select - The select statement to issue
        sb - User StringBuild which will have the results appended.

      • getCoord

        public double[] getCoord(java.lang.String net,
                         java.lang.String stat,
                         java.lang.String loc)
        close the connection to the server /** getCoord returns an array with the lat, long, and elev
        Parameters:
        net - The network code
        stat - The station code
        loc - The location code
        Returns:
        Array with lat, long and elev in that order. Zeros if station is unknown.

      • getComment

        public java.lang.String[] getComment(java.lang.String net,
                                     java.lang.String stat,
                                     java.lang.String loc)
        get station comment stuff, location long name and network
        Parameters:
        net - The network code
        stat - The station code
        loc - The location code
        Returns:
        Array with long name in first and network in second element. "Stasrv: unknown" and "Unknown"if error.

      • getTranslation

        public java.lang.String getTranslation(java.lang.String net,
                                       java.lang.String stat,
                                       java.lang.String loc,
                                       java.lang.String chan)
        Returns net sta loc chan translated into Hydra notation (if net = IR) or into Chicxulub notation otherwise. If no translation is found, the input is echoed (1 line, 15 characters).
        Parameters:
        net - The network code
        stat - The station code
        loc - The location code
        chan - The chanel code
        Returns:
        Array with long name in first and network in second element. Stasrv: Unknown" on error.

      • getSACResponse

        public java.lang.String getSACResponse(java.lang.String channel,
                                       java.lang.String date,
                                       java.lang.String unit)
        get the response using the meta data server syntax, if the regular expression is not unique, more than one response might be returned. This command uses MDS formats.
        Parameters:
        channel - regular expression to match
        date - Date for the epoch (yyyy/mm/dd-hh:mm)
        unit - The unit of the response (um or nm)
        Returns:

      • getSACResponse

        public int getSACResponse(java.lang.String channel,
                          java.lang.String date,
                          java.lang.String unit,
                          java.lang.StringBuilder sb)
        get the response using the meta data server syntax, if the regular expression is not unique, more than one response might be returned. This command uses MDS formats.
        Parameters:
        channel - regular expression to match
        date - Date for the epoch (yyyy/mm/dd-hh:mm)
        unit - The unit of the response (um or nm)
        sb - A user supplied StringBUilder (user must clear or it will be added to)
        Returns:

        public java.lang.String getSiteDescription(java.lang.String station)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the site description or "unknown station in MDS"

      • getSiteDescription

        public java.lang.String getSiteDescription(java.lang.String station,
                                           java.lang.String date)
        Get the site description only the given date. if date = all it will get the newest one
        Parameters:
        station - the NNSSSSS to get
        date - The date with all of the station epochs to get, if "all" then the latest one is returned
        Returns:
        the site description or "unknown station in MDS"

      • getMetaStation

        public java.lang.String[] getMetaStation(java.lang.String station)
        return the station text (see getMetaStation(station,date) for more details
        Parameters:
        station - A station regexp
        Returns:
        An array of strings with one string per line of the response station"

      • getMetaStation

        public java.lang.String[] getMetaStation(java.lang.String station,
                                         java.lang.String date)
        return the station description (example below) as an array of strings 
         * Station          3AL002
 IRcode
 OtherAlias
 EpochBegin       2010-03-30 00:00:00.0
 EpochEnd         2010-12-31 23:59:59.0
 SeedSiteName     D404
 SeedOwner        UK
 IRName
 IROwner
 SeedURL          ./METADATA/DATALESS/3A.dataless
 XMLURL           ./METADATA/XML/noxml.html
 Latitude         -38.2551
 Longitude        -72.257004
 Elevation        410.0
 SeedLatitude     -38.2551
 SeedLongitude    -72.257004
 SeedElevation    410.0
 SEEDElevMethod    SEED Elevation Method Unknown
        Parameters:
        station - A channel regular expression
        date - A MDS type date
        Returns:
        The array with long name in [0], network in [1] or [0] will contain *** MDS: unknown station"

      • getMetaCoord

        public double[] getMetaCoord(java.lang.String channel)
        return the coordinates using the metadata server method rather than old stasrv
        Parameters:
        channel - Channel regular expression
        Returns:
        Array with three values, if the station/channel is unknown all will be zero

      • getMetaCoord

        public double[] getMetaCoord(java.lang.String channel,
                             java.lang.String date)
        return the coordinates using the metadata server method rather than old stasrv
        Parameters:
        channel - Channel regular expression
        date - A string suitable for MDS consumption
        Returns:
        Array with three values, if the station/channel is unknown all will be zero

      • getCookedResponse

        public PNZ getCookedResponse(java.lang.String net,
                             java.lang.String stat,
                             java.lang.String loc,
                             java.lang.String chan)
        Returns net sta loc chan translated into Hydra notation (if net = IR) or into Chicxulub notation otherwise. If no translation is found, the input is echoed (1 line, 15 characters).
        Parameters:
        net - The network code
        stat - The station code
        loc - The location code
        chan - The chanel code
        Returns:
        a PNZ with the response. If error, the PNZ might be incomplete

      • mdget

        public java.lang.String mdget(java.lang.String[] args)

      • getOrientation

        public double[] getOrientation(java.lang.String net,
                               java.lang.String stat,
                               java.lang.String loc,
                               java.lang.String chan)
        get Orientation of the channel
        Parameters:
        net - network code
        stat - station code
        loc - location code
        chan - channel code
        Returns:
        3 element array 0=aszimuth in degress clockwize from north, 1=dip in degrees from horizontal, 2=depth in meters from surface.
